definition: to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
to plagiarize/to copy/to attack the flank or rear of an enemy
to take inventory of and confiscate a criminal's possessions/to search and confiscate (forbidden items)/to raid
to make a copy (and send it to someone)/Cc (for email)/Carbon Copy (for email)
to search a house and confiscate possessions
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
to execute the whole family and confiscate their property

sentences.english: If the car does not yield to pedestrian, the car could be ticketed.
sentences.chinese: 大多數國家，如果車子不給行人讓路，會被抄罰單的。

sentences.english: He transcribed two paragraphs from the book into his notebook.
sentences.chinese: 他把書中的兩段抄在筆記本上。

sentences.english: I made no copy of it.
sentences.chinese: 遺憾的是，我沒有抄一份留底。

sentences.english: Unable to withstand my importunity he would make out drafts for me to copy.
sentences.chinese: 他受不了我的糾纏，就先擬出草稿叫我去抄。

sentences.english: Sophie quickly found some paper and copied it down longhand .
sentences.chinese: 索菲很快找了一張紙條，用速記法把它抄了下來。

sentences.english: But just at that time, Gou Jian, king of the State of Yue, outflanked Fu Chai and attacked him in the rear.
sentences.chinese: 可正在這個時候，越王勾踐抄了吳王的後路。

sentences.english: Then I put Taro Mori Kizu home phone addresses are copied to him.
sentences.chinese: 隨後我把森木津太郎家嘅電話地址都抄俾咗佢。

sentences.english: Copy this book in your notebook.
sentences.chinese: 把這本書抄到筆記本上。

sentences.english: They would take that letter,and they would make a copy of it.
Why do you want to copy my homework?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼你要抄我的作業？

sentences.english: The tutor copied one from the book and gave it to the rich man.
sentences.chinese: 這個塾師從書本上抄了一篇，就把祭文給了富人。

sentences.english: We should try our best to make our country more beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 老師要我們把那一段再抄一遍。

sentences.english: Please make a fair copy of the manuscript.
Bleek : You copy my work every week.
I have copied the information habits.
She immediately copied the letter in her notebook.
sentences.chinese: 她立即把這封信抄在她的筆記本里。

definition: to write without lifting one's pen from the paper/(in the Romanization of Chinese) to write two or more syllables together as a single word (not separated by spaces)
lit. to draw a dipper with a gourd as a model (idiom)/fig. to copy slavishly
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
lit. drawing a tiger using a cat as a model (idiom); fig. to follow a model and get things more or less right but without capturing the spirit of the subject/uninspired imitation
lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
